column2:
n. a member of the Caucasoid race
n. the quality or state of the achromatic color of greatest lightness (bearing the least resemblance to black)
n. United States jurist appointed chief justice of the United States Supreme Court in 1910 by President Taft; noted for his work on antitrust legislation (1845-1921)
n. Australian writer (1912-1990)

n. a purple color or pigment
n. of imperial status
v. become purple
v. color purple

n. a light shade of red

v. sound like a car engine that is firing too early

n. round yellow to orange fruit of any of several citrus trees

n. any pigment producing the orange color

n. an orange of low brightness and saturation
n. Scottish botanist who first observed the movement of small particles in fluids now known a Brownian motion (1773-1858)
n. abolitionist who was hanged after leading an unsuccessful raid at Harper's Ferry, Virginia (1800-1859)
v. fry in a pan until it changes color

n. the quality or state of the achromatic color of least lightness (bearing the least resemblance to white)
n. British chemist who identified carbon dioxide and who formulated the concepts of specific heat and latent heat (1728-1799)
n. popular child actress of the 1930's (born in 1928)
n. a person with dark skin who comes from Africa (or whose ancestors came from Africa)

n. a small portable timepiece
n. a period of time (4 or 2 hours) during which some of a ship's crew are on duty

n. the period during which someone (especially a guard) is on duty

n. a flexible container with a single opening
n. the quantity of game taken in a particular period (usually by one person)

n. the quantity that a bag will hold

a. yielding readily to pressure or weight

a. (of sound) relatively low in volume
a. not protected against attack (especially by nuclear weapons)

a. dispassionate; 
a. resisting weight or pressure
s. very strong or vigorous
a. (of light) transmitted directly from a pointed light source

n. the part of a golf course bordering the fairway where the grass is not cut short
a. having or caused by an irregular surface
s. (of persons or behavior) lacking refinement or finesse
a. of the margin of a leaf shape; having the edge cut or fringed or scalloped

n. the act of smoothing
v. make smooth or smoother, as if by rubbing
v. free from obstructions
a. having a surface free from roughness or bumps or ridges or irregularities

n. public transport provided by a line of railway cars coupled together and drawn by a locomotive

n. a vehicle carrying many passengers; used for public transport
n. a car that is old and unreliable
v. send or move around by bus
v. ride in a bus

n. a motor vehicle with four wheels; usually propelled by an internal combustion engine

n. the compartment that is suspended from an airship and that carries personnel and the cargo and the power plant

n. (Great Britain) a closed railroad car that carries baggage or freight

n. a truck with an enclosed cargo space

n. a wheeled vehicle that has two wheels and is moved by foot pedals

n. a vessel that carries passengers or freight

v. travel by ship
v. place on board a ship

n. a score in baseball made by a runner touching all four bases safely

n. the act of running; traveling on foot at a fast pace

n. sports equipment that is worn on the feet to enable the wearer to glide along and to be propelled by the alternate actions of the legs

n. the act of hopping; jumping upward or forward (especially on one foot)

n. a gait in which steps and hops alternate
v. bound off one point after another
none
n. food mixtures either arranged on a plate or tossed and served with a moist dressing; usually consisting of or including greens

n. deep orange edible root of the cultivated carrot plant
n. perennial plant widely cultivated as an annual in many varieties for its long conical orange edible roots; temperate and tropical regions
n. orange root; important source of carotene
n. promise of reward as in "carrot and stick";

n. any of various mostly cold-blooded aquatic vertebrates usually having scales and breathing through gills
n. the flesh of fish used as food
v. seek indirectly
v. catch or try to catch fish or shellfish

n. the flesh of a chicken used for food
n. a domestic fowl bred for flesh or eggs; believed to have been developed from the red jungle fowl

s. easily frightened

n. tallest living quadruped; having a spotted coat and small horns and very long neck and legs; of savannahs of tropical Africa

n. limbless scaly elongate reptile; some are venomous

n. something long, thin, and flexible that resembles a snake

n. five-toed pachyderm

n. the quality of being at a refreshingly low temperature

v. lose intensity

n. a mild viral infection involving the nose and respiratory passages (but not the lungs)

a. extended meanings; especially of psychological coldness; without human warmth or emotion

n. the event of something ending

n. a time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
